entry.content:
组合数

Anm=n!(n−m)!,Cnm=(nm)=n!m!(n−m)!A_n^m=\frac {n!} {(n-m)!},C_n^m=\binom n m=\frac {n!} {m!(n-m)!}Anm​=(n−m)!n!​,Cnm​=(mn​)=m!(n−m)!n!​

性质

  1. (a+b)n=∑i=0n(ni)an−ibi(a+b)^n=\sum_{i=0}^n\binom n ia^{n-i}b^i(a+b)n=∑i=0n​(in​)an−ibi
  2. (nm)=(nn−m)\binom n m=\binom n {n-m}(mn​)=(n−mn​)
  3. (nk)=nk(n−1k−1)\binom n k=\frac n k\binom {n-1} {k-1}(kn​)=kn​(k−1n−1​)
  4. (nm)=(n−1m)+(n−1m−1)\binom n m=\binom {n-1} m+\binom {n-1}{m-1}(mn​)=(mn−1​)+(m−1n−1​)
  5. ∑i=0n(ni)=2n\sum_{i=0}^n\binom n i=2^n∑i=0n​(in​)=2n
  6. ∑i=0n(−1)i(ni)=0\sum_{i=0}^n (-1)^i \binom n i=0∑i=0n​(−1)i(in​)=0
  7. ∑i=0m(ni)(mm−i)=(m+nm)(n≥m)\sum_{i=0}^m \binom n i\binom m {m-i}=\binom {m+n} m(n\geq m)∑i=0m​(in​)(m−im​)=(mm+n​)(n≥m)

  9. ∑i=0ni(ni)=n⋅2n−1\sum_{i=0}^n i\binom n i=n\cdot 2^{n-1}∑i=0n​i(in​)=n⋅2n−1

  12. (nr)(rk)=(nk)(n−kr−k)\binom n r\binom r k=\binom n k\binom {n-k} {r-k}(rn​)(kr​)=(kn​)(r−kn−k​)
  13. ∑i=0n(n−ii)=Fn+1\sum_{i=0}^n\binom {n-i} i=F_{n+1}∑i=0n​(in−i​)=Fn+1​, FiF_iFi​ denotes the i-th value of Fibonacci Sequence.

多重集组合数公式

多重集表示S={n1⋅a1,n2⋅a2,⋯ ,nk⋅ak}S=\{n_1\cdot a_1,n_2\cdot a_2,\cdots,n_k\cdot a_k\}S={n1​⋅a1​,n2​⋅a2​,⋯,nk​⋅ak​}，由nin_ini​个aia_iai​组成的集合。

  1. 全排列个数：n!Πi=1kni!\frac {n!} {\Pi_{i=1}^k n_i!}Πi=1k​ni​!n!​
  2. 对任意r<∀nir<\forall n_ir<∀ni​，从S中选出r个元素组成一个多重集的方案数=(r+k−1k−1)\binom {r+k-1} {k-1}(k−1r+k−1​)。

其他类型排列组合公式

  1. 从1~n中选k个数，两两不相邻的组合数有(n−k+1k)\binom {n-k+1} k(kn−k+1​)种。
  2. 错位排列：fn=(n−1)(fn−1+fn−2)f_n=(n-1)(f_{n-1}+f_{n-2})fn​=(n−1)(fn−1​+fn−2​)，前几项为0,1,2,9,44,2650,1,2,9,44,2650,1,2,9,44,265。
  3. 圆排列：n个不同元素中取出m个不同的元素排成一个环形，排列数有Anmn\frac {A_n^m} nnAnm​​种。

Lucas定理

(nm) mod p=(⌊n/p⌋⌊m/p⌋)⋅(n mod pm mod p) mod p\binom{n}{m}\bmod p = \binom{\left\lfloor n/p \right\rfloor}{\left\lfloor m/p\right\rfloor}\cdot\binom{n\bmod p}{m\bmod p}\bmod p(mn​)modp=(⌊m/p⌋⌊n/p⌋​)⋅(mmodpnmodp​)modp，p为质数。

ll lucas(ll n, ll m) {
    return m == 0 ? 1 : C(n%p, m%p) * lucas(n/p, m/p) % p;
}

exlucas

p不为质数时，使用exlucas算法求解(nm) mod p\binom n m\bmod p(mn​)modp。

ll A[N], B[N];
namespace Lucas
{
	ll F(ll n, ll P, ll PK)
	{
		if (n == 0)
			return 1;
		ll rou = 1;
		ll rem = 1;
		for (ll i = 1; i <= PK; i++)
		{
			if (i % P)
				rou = rou * i % PK;
		}
		rou = qpow(rou, n / PK, PK);
		for (ll i = PK * (n / PK); i <= n; i++)
		{
			if (i % P)
				rem = rem * (i % PK) % PK;
		}
		return F(n / P, P, PK) * rou % PK * rem % PK;
	}
	ll G(ll n, ll P)
	{
		if (n < P)
			return 0;
		return G(n / P, P) + (n / P);
	}
	ll C_PK(ll n, ll m, ll P, ll PK)
	{
		ll fz = F(n, P, PK), fm1 = INV(F(m, P, PK), PK), fm2 = INV(F(n - m, P, PK), PK);
		ll mi = qpow(P, G(n, P) - G(m, P) - G(n - m, P), PK);
		return fz * fm1 % PK * fm2 % PK * mi % PK;
	}
	ll exlucas(ll n, ll m, ll P)
	{
		ll ljc = P, tot = 0;
		for (ll tmp = 2; tmp * tmp <= P; tmp++)
		{
			if (!(ljc % tmp))
			{
				ll PK = 1;
				while (!(ljc % tmp))
				{
					PK *= tmp;
					ljc /= tmp;
				}
				A[++tot] = PK;
				B[tot] = C_PK(n, m, tmp, PK);
			}
		}
		if (ljc != 1)
		{
			A[++tot] = ljc;
			B[tot] = C_PK(n, m, ljc, ljc);
		}
		ll ans = 0;
		for (ll i = 1; i <= tot; i++)
		{
			ll M = P / A[i], T = INV(M, A[i]);
			ans = (ans + B[i] * M % P * T % P) % P;
		}
		return ans;
	}
} // namespace Lucas

Catalan/Stirling/Bell数

👉Catalan👉Stirling👉Bell

康托展开

O(n2)/O(nlog⁡n)O(n^2)/O(n\log n)O(n2)/O(nlogn)求1~n排列中任意排列的排名。代码使用树状数组，复杂度为O(nlog⁡n)O(n\log n)O(nlogn)。

int contour()
{
	for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++)
		add(i, 1);
	for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++)
	{
		ans = (ans + fac[n - i] * sum(p[i])) % mod;
		add(p[i], -1);
	}
	return (ans + 1) % mod; // 排名从1开始
}

pip_ipi​表示给定的排列。

逆康托展开

给定排名，求排列。暴力求解，复杂度O(n2)O(n^2)O(n2)。

vector<int> incontour(int rk)
{
	rk--; // 排名从1开始
	vector<int> v;
	for (int i = 1; i < n; ++i)
	{
		int kk = rk / fac[n - i] + 1;
		int z = 0;
		rk = rk % fac[n - i];
		for (int j = 1; j <= n; ++j)
		{
			if (!b[j])
				z++;
			if (z == kk)
			{
				v.push_back(j);
				b[j] = 1;
				break;
			}
		}
	}
	return v;
}

抽屉原理

n个苹果放进k个抽屉里，必然至少一个抽屉里有不少于⌊nk⌋\lfloor \frac n k\rfloor⌊kn​⌋个苹果。

反之，如果k个抽屉，每个都有不超过⌊nk⌋\lfloor \frac n k\rfloor⌊kn​⌋个苹果，则苹果总和不超过k(⌊nk⌋−1)k(\lfloor\frac n k\rfloor-1)k(⌊kn​⌋−1)个。

entry.title: ACM数论知识笔记(English version)
entry.content:
Quick Power and Slow Multiply

This can calculate ab mod pa^b\bmod pabmodp in O(log⁡2n)O(\log_2n)O(log2​n) complexity.

ll qpow(ll a, ll b, ll p) {
  ll res = 1;
  while (b) {
    if (b & 1) res = res * a % p;
    a = a * a % p;
    b >>= 1;
  }
  return res;
}

This can calculate a×b mod pa\times b\bmod pa×bmodp in O(log⁡2n)O(\log_2n)O(log2​n) complexity.

inline ll smul(ll a, ll b, ll p) {
  ll res = 0;
  while (b) {
	if (b & 1)
      res = (res + a) % p;
	a = (a << 1) % p;
    b >>= 1;
  }
  return res;
}

This can calculate a×b mod pa\times b\bmod pa×bmodp in O(1)O(1)O(1) complexity.

inline ll smul(ll a, ll b, ll p) {
	ll z = (ld)a / p * b;
	ll res = (ull)a * b - (ull)z * p;
	return (res + p) % p;
}

Divisor

Greatest Common Divisor

Use STL instead.#include <algorithm>

LCM(a,b)=abgcd(a,b)LCM(a,b)=\frac {ab} {gcd(a,b)}LCM(a,b)=gcd(a,b)ab​

Extended Euclidean

Used to solve the equation in this format ax+by=gcd(a,b)ax+by=gcd(a,b)ax+by=gcd(a,b).

The equation ax+by=cax+by=cax+by=c has a solution when gcd⁡(a,b)∣c\gcd(a,b)|cgcd(a,b)∣c.

ll Exgcd(ll a, ll b, ll &x, ll &y) {
  if (!b) {
    x = 1;
    y = 0;
    return a;
  }
  ll d = Exgcd(b, a % b, x, y);
  ll t = x;
  x = y;
  y = t - (a / b) * y;
  return d;
}

Its return value denotes gcd⁡(a,b)\gcd(a,b)gcd(a,b).

Solve the congruent equation

The equation ax≡c(modb)ax\equiv c\pmod bax≡c(modb) has integer solution if and only if gcd⁡(a,b)∣c\gcd(a,b)\mid cgcd(a,b)∣c satisfies.

One of the solutions which satisfies the origin equation is x=(x mod t+t) mod tx=(x\bmod t+t)\bmod tx=(xmodt+t)modt, t denotes bgcd⁡(a,b)\frac b {\gcd(a,b)}gcd(a,b)b​.

We can use extended euclidean algorithm to solve it.

Sieve for the number of divisors

did_idi​ denotes the number of divisors of iii.

void pre() {
  d[1] = 1;
  for (int i = 2; i <= n; ++i) {
    if (!v[i]) v[i] = 1, p[++tot] = i, d[i] = 2, num[i] = 1;
    for (int j = 1; j <= tot && i <= n / p[j]; ++j) {
      v[p[j] * i] = 1;
      if (i % p[j] == 0) {
        num[i * p[j]] = num[i] + 1;
        d[i * p[j]] = d[i] / num[i * p[j]] * (num[i * p[j]] + 1);
        break;
      } else {
        num[i * p[j]] = 1;
        d[i * p[j]] = d[i] * 2;
      }
    }
  }
}

Sieve for the sum of divisors

fif_ifi​ denotes the sum of divisors of iii.

void pre() {
  g[1] = f[1] = 1;
  for (int i = 2; i <= n; ++i) {
    if (!v[i]) v[i] = 1, p[++tot] = i, g[i] = i + 1, f[i] = i + 1;
    for (int j = 1; j <= tot && i <= n / p[j]; ++j) {
      v[p[j] * i] = 1;
      if (i % p[j] == 0) {
        g[i * p[j]] = g[i] * p[j] + 1;
        f[i * p[j]] = f[i] / g[i] * g[i * p[j]];
        break;
      } else {
        f[i * p[j]] = f[i] * f[p[j]];
        g[i * p[j]] = 1 + p[j];
      }
    }
  }
  for (int i = 1; i <= n; ++i) f[i] = (f[i - 1] + f[i]) % Mod;
}

Euclidean-like algorithm

  1. f(a,b,c,n)=∑i=0n⌊ai+bc⌋f(a,b,c,n)=\sum_{i=0}^n\lfloor\frac {ai+b} c\rfloorf(a,b,c,n)=∑i=0n​⌊cai+b​⌋
  2. g(a,b,c,n)=∑i=0ni⌊ai+bc⌋g(a,b,c,n)=\sum_{i=0}^ni\lfloor\frac {ai+b} c\rfloorg(a,b,c,n)=∑i=0n​i⌊cai+b​⌋
  3. h(a,b,c,n)=∑i=0n⌊ai+bc⌋2h(a,b,c,n)=\sum_{i=0}^n\lfloor\frac {ai+b} c\rfloor^2h(a,b,c,n)=∑i=0n​⌊cai+b​⌋2

Their solutions are:

{f=nm−f(c,c−b−1,a,m−1)g=12[nm(n+1)−h(c,c−b−1,a,m−1)−f(c,c−b−1,a,m−1)]h=nm(m+1)−2g(c,c−b−1,a,m−1)−2f(c,c−b−1,a,m−1)−f(a,b,c,n)\begin{cases}f=nm-f(c,c-b-1,a,m-1)\\g=\frac 1 2[nm(n+1)-h(c,c-b-1,a,m-1)-f(c,c-b-1,a,m-1)]\\h=nm(m+1)-2g(c,c-b-1,a,m-1)-2f(c,c-b-1,a,m-1)-f(a,b,c,n)\end{cases}⎩⎪⎨⎪⎧​f=nm−f(c,c−b−1,a,m−1)g=21​[nm(n+1)−h(c,c−b−1,a,m−1)−f(c,c−b−1,a,m−1)]h=nm(m+1)−2g(c,c−b−1,a,m−1)−2f(c,c−b−1,a,m−1)−f(a,b,c,n)​

where m denotes ⌊an+bc⌋\lfloor\frac {an+b} c\rfloor⌊can+b​⌋.

const ll P = 998244353;
ll i2 = 499122177, i6 = 166374059;
struct data {
  data() { f = g = h = 0; }
  ll f, g, h;
};
data calc(ll n, ll a, ll b, ll c) {
  ll ac = a / c, bc = b / c, m = (a * n + b) / c, n1 = n + 1, n21 = n * 2 + 1;
  data d;
  if (a == 0) {
    d.f = bc * n1 % P;
    d.g = bc * n % P * n1 % P * i2 % P;
    d.h = bc * bc % P * n1 % P;
    return d;
  }
  if (a >= c || b >= c) {
    d.f = n * n1 % P * i2 % P * ac % P + bc * n1 % P;
    d.g = ac * n % P * n1 % P * n21 % P * i6 % P + bc * n % P * n1 % P * i2 % P;
    d.h = ac * ac % P * n % P * n1 % P * n21 % P * i6 % P +
          bc * bc % P * n1 % P + ac * bc % P * n % P * n1 % P;
    d.f %= P, d.g %= P, d.h %= P;

    data e = calc(n, a % c, b % c, c);

    d.h += e.h + 2 * bc % P * e.f % P + 2 * ac % P * e.g % P;
    d.g += e.g, d.f += e.f;
    d.f %= P, d.g %= P, d.h %= P;
    return d;
  }
  data e = calc(m - 1, c, c - b - 1, a);
  d.f = n * m % P - e.f, d.f = (d.f % P + P) % P;
  d.g = m * n % P * n1 % P - e.h - e.f, d.g = (d.g * i2 % P + P) % P;
  d.h = n * m % P * (m + 1) % P - 2 * e.g - 2 * e.f - d.f;
  d.h = (d.h % P + P) % P;
  return d;
}
int main() {
  scanf("%lld%lld%lld%lld", &n, &a, &b, &c);
  data ans = calc(n, a, b, c);
  printf("%lld %lld %lld\n", ans.f, ans.h, ans.g);
}

The variables i2 and i6 denotes the inverse of 2 and 6 modulo 998244353.

Prime

Primality testing

Brute-force

bool isPrime(int a) {
  if (a < 2) return 0;
  for (int i = 2; i * i <= a; ++i)
    if (a % i == 0) return 0;
  return 1;
}

The time complexity is O(n)O(\sqrt n)O(n​).

Miller-Rabin

bool millerRabbin(int n) {
  if (n < 3) return n == 2;
  int a = n - 1, b = 0;
  while (a % 2 == 0) a /= 2, ++b;
  for (int i = 1, j; i <= test_time ++i) {
    int x = rand() % (n - 2) + 2, v = quickPow(x, a, n);
    if (v == 1 || v == n - 1) continue;
    for (j = 0; j < b; ++j) {
      v = (long long)v * v % n;
      if (v == n - 1) break;
    }
    if (j >= b) return 0;
  }
  return 1;
}

The time complexity is O(klog⁡3n)O(k\log^3 n)O(klog3n), which k denotes test_time.

Sieve for prime

void init() {
  phi[1] = 1;
  for (int i = 2; i < MAXN; ++i) {
    if (!vis[i]) {
      phi[i] = i - 1;
      pri[ptot++] = i;
    }
    for (int j = 0; j < ptot; ++j) {
      if (1ll * i * pri[j] >= MAXN) break;
      vis[i * pri[j]] = 1;
      if (i % pri[j])
        phi[i * pri[j]] = phi[i] * (pri[j] - 1);
      else {
        phi[i * pri[j]] = phi[i] * pri[j];
        break;
      }
    }
  }
}

It's time complexity is O(MAXN)O(\text{MAXN})O(MAXN). It also sieves the euler function φ(n)\varphi(n)φ(n).

Inverse

Definition

If ax≡1(modb)ax\equiv 1\pmod bax≡1(modb), then x is called the inverse of a%ba\% ba%b.

Solving

Extend Euclid

By constructing ax+by=1ax+by=1ax+by=1, x is the inverse.

ll inv(ll a, ll b)
{
    ll x, y;
    exgcd(a, b, x, y);
    return (x + b) % b;
}

Quick Power

According to the Fermat Theorem, x≡ab−2(modb)x\equiv a^{b-2}\pmod bx≡ab−2(modb).

Linear solving

If p is not large, we can conclude that i−1≡{1,i=1−⌊pi⌋(p mod i)−1,otherwises(modp)i^{-1} \equiv \begin{cases} 1, & i = 1 \\ -\lfloor\frac{p}{i}\rfloor (p \bmod i)^{-1}, & \text{otherwises} \end{cases} \pmod pi−1≡{1,−⌊ip​⌋(pmodi)−1,​i=1otherwises​(modp)

inv[1] = 1;
for (int i = 2; i <= n; ++i)
  inv[i] = (long long)(p - p / i) * inv[p % i] % p;

Sieve for multi-point

s[0] = 1;
for (int i = 1; i <= n; ++i) s[i] = s[i - 1] * a[i] % p;
sv[n] = qpow(s[n], p - 2);
for (int i = n; i >= 1; --i) sv[i - 1] = sv[i] * a[i] % p;
for (int i = 1; i <= n; ++i) inv[i] = sv[i] * s[i - 1] % p;

Here sis_isi​ denotes the prefix production, svisv_isvi​ denotes the inverse. Time complexity: O(n+log⁡p)O(n+\log p)O(n+logp).

China remainder Theorem

It's used to solve the system of linear congruence of one variable like this:(nin_ini​ are co-prime)

$\begin{cases} x &\equiv a_1 \pmod {n_1} \ x &\equiv a_2 \pmod {n_2} \ &\vdots \ x &\equiv a_k \pmod {n_k} \ \end{cases} $

Procedure

  1. Calculate n=Πnin=\Pi n_in=Πni​.
  2. For the i-th equation:
    1. Let mi=nnim_i=\frac n {n_i}mi​=ni​n​.
    2. Calculate the inverse of mim_imi​ modulo nin_ini​.
    3. Calculate ci=mi⋅mi−1c_i=m_i\cdot m_i^{-1}ci​=mi​⋅mi−1​.Do not modulo n!
  3. The solution is x=∑i=1kaici(modn)x=\sum_{i=1}^k a_ic_i\pmod nx=∑i=1k​ai​ci​(modn).
for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
  ll t = mod / n[i];
  ll k = qpow(t, n[i] - 2, n[i]);
  ll tmp = (m[i] * t % mod * k) % mod;
  ans = (ans + tmp) % mod;
}

Extended China remainder theorem

$\begin{cases}x\equiv a_1 \pmod {m_1}\x\equiv a_2 \pmod {m_2}\end{cases} $

We convert them into this equation: x=m1p+a1=m2q+a2x=m_1p+a_1=m_2q+a_2x=m1​p+a1​=m2​q+a2​, i.e. m1p−m2q=a2−a1m_1p-m_2q=a_2-a_1m1​p−m2​q=a2​−a1​.

If gcd⁡(m1,m2)∤a2−a1\gcd(m_1,m_2)\nmid a_2-a_1gcd(m1​,m2​)∤a2​−a1​, then it has no solution.

Otherwise, we can construct a solution (p,q)(p,q)(p,q), st. x≡b(modM),b=m1p+a1,M=lcm⁡(m1,m2)x\equiv b\pmod M, b=m_1p+a_1,M=\operatorname{lcm}(m_1,m_2)x≡b(modM),b=m1​p+a1​,M=lcm(m1​,m2​).

Extended Euclidean algorithm is used to construct such solution.

ll exCRT()
{
	ll p, q;
	ll lcm = m[1], x = a[1];
	for (int i = 2; i <= n; i++)
	{
		ll b = m[i], c = (a[i] - x % b + b) % b;
		exgcd(lcm, m[i], p, q);
		ll gcd = __gcd(lcm, m[i]), M = m[i] / gcd;

		// No solution if
		// gcd(m1,m2) cannot divide (a2-a1) exactly
		if (c % gcd != 0)
			return -1;

		// If the data range is too large,
		// use slow_multiply instead.
		p = p * c / gcd % M;

		x += p * lcm;
		lcm *= M;
		x = (x % lcm + lcm) % lcm;
	}
	return (x % lcm + lcm) % lcm;
}

Quadratic residue

Waiting for completion...

BSGS

It's used to solve:ax≡b(modp),a⊥pa^x\equiv b\pmod p,a\bot pax≡b(modp),a⊥p.

Steps

  1. Let x=A⌈p⌉−B,0≤A,B,≤⌈p⌉x=A\left \lceil \sqrt p \right \rceil -B,0\leq A,B,\leq \lceil \sqrt p \rceilx=A⌈p​⌉−B,0≤A,B,≤⌈p​⌉. Now we have aA⌈p⌉−B≡b(modp)a^{A\left \lceil \sqrt p \right \rceil -B} \equiv b \pmod paA⌈p​⌉−B≡b(modp), i.e. aA⌈p⌉≡baB(modp)a^{A\left \lceil \sqrt p \right \rceil} \equiv ba^B \pmod paA⌈p​⌉≡baB(modp).
  2. Enumerating B and storing its value in map/hash.
  3. Enumerating A and calculate aA⌈p⌉a^{A\lceil\sqrt p\rceil}aA⌈p​⌉. If it's equal to baBba^BbaB, then we can get x.
ll BSGS(ll a, ll b, ll p, ll c) {
	// For common BSGS questions which gcd(a,p)=1,
	// we can directly let c = 1.
	Hash.clear();
	ll m = ceil(sqrt(p)), t = 1;
	for (ll i = 0; i < m; i++, t = t * a % p) Hash[t * b % p] = i;
	for (ll i = 0, tmp = t, t = c; i <= m; i++, t = t * tmp % p)
		if (Hash.count(t))
			// If there's no requirement that the answer be larger than 0,
			// then return i*m-Hash[t] is ok.
			if (i * m - Hash[t] >= 0)
				return i * m - Hash[t];
	return -1;
}

Forward: gcd⁡(a,p)≠1\gcd(a,p)\neq 1gcd(a,p)​=1

  1. Let d1=gcd⁡(a,p)d_1=\gcd(a,p)d1​=gcd(a,p).
  2. If d1∤bd_1\nmid bd1​∤b, it has no solution. Otherwise, we divide it by d1d_1d1​. Now we have $\frac{a}{d_1}\cdot a^{x-1}\equiv \frac{b}{d_1}\pmod{\frac{p}{d_1}} $.
  3. If gcd⁡(a,pd1)≠1\gcd(a,\frac p {d_1})\ne 1gcd(a,d1​p​)​=1, then we repeat dividing d1d_1d1​ till it satisfies.
  4. Let d2=gcd⁡(a,pd1)d_2=\gcd(a,\frac p {d_1})d2​=gcd(a,d1​p​). If d2∤bd1d_2\nmid \frac b {d_1}d2​∤d1​b​, it has no solution. Otherwise, repeat step 1~3 till a⊥pd1d2⋯dka\bot\frac p {d_1d_2\cdots d_k}a⊥d1​d2​⋯dk​p​.
  5. Let D=Πi=1kdiD=\Pi_{i=1}^k d_iD=Πi=1k​di​. Now it becomes $\frac{a^k}{D}\cdot a^{x-k}\equiv\frac{b}{D} \pmod{\frac{p}{D}} $, i.e. ax−k≡bak(modpak)a^{x-k}\equiv\frac{b}{a^k} \pmod{\frac{p}{a^k}}ax−k≡akb​(modakp​).
  6. Finally it is converted to a normal BSGS problem.
ll exBSGS(ll a, ll b, ll p) {
	ll k = 0, c = 1;
	if (b == 1) return 0;
	while (true) {
		ll d = __gcd(a, p);
		if (d == 1) break;
		if (b % d) return -1; // No solution
		++k, b /= d, p /= d, c = c * (a / d) % p;
		if (b == c) return k;
	}
	ll ans = BSGS(a, b, p, c);
	if (ans == -1) return -1; // No solution
	return ans + k;
}

The Euler function

Definition

φ(n)=∑i=1n[gcd⁡(i,n)==1]\varphi(n)=\sum_{i=1}^{n} [\gcd(i,n)==1]φ(n)=∑i=1n​[gcd(i,n)==1]

Properties

  1. φ(n)=n−1 iff.n is prime\varphi(n)=n-1\ iff.n\ is\ primeφ(n)=n−1 iff.n is prime
  2. Multiplicative function
    1. gcd⁡(a,b)=1⇒φ(a×b)=φ(a)×φ(b)\gcd(a,b)=1\Rightarrow \varphi(a\times b)=\varphi(a)\times \varphi(b)gcd(a,b)=1⇒φ(a×b)=φ(a)×φ(b)
    2. n%2=1⇒φ(2n)=φ(n)n\%2=1\Rightarrow\varphi(2n)=\varphi(n)n%2=1⇒φ(2n)=φ(n)
  3. n=∑d∣nφ(d)n=\sum_{d|n}\varphi(d)n=∑d∣n​φ(d)
  4. n=pk,p is prime⇒φ(n)=pk−pk−1n=p^k,p\ is\ prime\Rightarrow\varphi(n)=p^k-p^{k-1}n=pk,p is prime⇒φ(n)=pk−pk−1
  5. Assume n=Πpiki,pi is prime,then φ(n)=n×Πpi−1piAssume\ n=\Pi p_i^{k_i},p_i\ is\ prime,then\ \varphi(n)=n\times\Pi\frac {p_i-1}{p_i}Assume n=Πpiki​​,pi​ is prime,then φ(n)=n×Πpi​pi​−1​

Solving

1. Solve on single point

Use the definition and Prop 5.

int euler_phi(int n) {
  int m = int(sqrt(n + 0.5));
  int ans = n;
  for (int i = 2; i <= m; i++)
    if (n % i == 0) {
      ans = ans / i * (i - 1);
      while (n % i == 0) n /= i;
    }
  if (n > 1) ans = ans / n * (n - 1);
  return ans;
}

The time complexity is O(n)O(\sqrt n)O(n​).

2. Sieve between [1,n]

Use the definition, Prop 2.1 & 5.

void phi_table(int n, int* phi) {
  for (int i = 2; i <= n; i++) phi[i] = 0;
  phi[1] = 1;
  for (int i = 2; i <= n; i++)
    if (!phi[i])
      for (int j = i; j <= n; j += i) {
        if (!phi[j]) phi[j] = j;
        phi[j] = phi[j] / i * (i - 1);
      }
}

or this:

void init() {
  phi[1] = 1;
  for (int i = 2; i < MAXN; ++i) {
    if (!mark[i]) {
      phi[i] = i - 1;
      pri[++ptot] = i;
    }
    for (int j = 1; j <= ptot && i * pri[j] < MAXN; ++j) {
      mark[i * pri[j]] = 1;
      if (i % pri[j])
        phi[i * pri[j]] = phi[i] * (pri[j] - 1);
      else {
        phi[i * pri[j]] = phi[i] * pri[j];
        break;
      }
    }
  }
}

The time complexity is O(n)O(n)O(n).

The Mobius function

Definition

μ(n)={1,n=10,n has square factor(−1)k,k is the number of different prime factors of n\mu(n)=\begin{cases}1&,n=1\\0&,n\text{ has square factor}\\(-1)^k&,k\text{ is the number of different prime factors of }n\end{cases}μ(n)=⎩⎪⎨⎪⎧​10(−1)k​,n=1,n has square factor,k is the number of different prime factors of n​

Properties

  1. Multiplicative function
  2. ∑d∣nμ(d)={1,n=10,n≠1=ε(n)\sum_{d\mid n}\mu(d)=\begin{cases}1&,n=1\\0&,n\neq 1\end{cases}=\varepsilon(n)∑d∣n​μ(d)={10​,n=1,n​=1​=ε(n)
  3. ∑d∣gcd⁡(i,j)μ(d)=[gcd⁡(i,j)=1]\sum_{d\mid \gcd(i,j)}\mu(d)=[\gcd(i,j)=1]∑d∣gcd(i,j)​μ(d)=[gcd(i,j)=1]

Solving

1. Solve on single point

Use the definition.

int mobius(int x) {

    int now = 0;

2. Sieve between [1,n]

Use the definition and Prop 1.

void getMu() {
  mu[1] = 1;
  for (int i = 2; i <= n; i++) {
    if (!mark[i]) p[++ptot] = i, mu[i] = -1;

Extended Euler theorem:ab≡{ab mod φ(p), gcd⁡(a, p)=1ab,gcd⁡(a, p)≠1, b<φ(p)ab mod φ(p)+φ(p),gcd⁡(a, p)≠1, b≥φ(p)(modp)a^b\equiv \begin{cases} a^{b\bmod\varphi(p)},\,&\gcd(a,\,p)=1\\ a^b,&\gcd(a,\,p)\ne1,\,b<\varphi(p)\\ a^{b\bmod\varphi(p)+\varphi(p)},&\gcd(a,\,p)\ne1,\,b\ge\varphi(p) \end{cases} \pmod pab≡⎩⎪⎨⎪⎧​abmodφ(p),ab,abmodφ(p)+φ(p),​gcd(a,p)=1gcd(a,p)​=1,b<φ(p)gcd(a,p)​=1,b≥φ(p)​(modp)

👏 欢迎使用 Gridea ！
✍️ Gridea 一个静态博客写作客户端。你可以用它来记录你的生活、心情、知识、笔记、创意... ...

Github
Gridea 主页
示例网站

特性👇

📝 你可以使用最酷的 Markdown 语法，进行快速创作

🌉 你可以给文章配上精美的封面图和在文章任意位置插入图片

🏷️ 你可以对文章进行标签分组

📋 你可以自定义菜单，甚至可以创建外部链接菜单

💻 你可以在 Windows，MacOS 或 Linux 设备上使用此客户端

🌎 你可以使用 𝖦𝗂𝗍𝗁𝗎𝖻 𝖯𝖺𝗀𝖾𝗌 或 Coding Pages 向世界展示，未来将支持更多平台

💬 你可以进行简单的配置，接入 Gitalk 或 DisqusJS 评论系统

🇬🇧 你可以使用中文简体或英语

🌁 你可以任意使用应用内默认主题或任意第三方主题，强大的主题自定义能力

🖥 你可以自定义源文件夹，利用 OneDrive、百度网盘、iCloud、Dropbox 等进行多设备同步

🌱 当然 Gridea 还很年轻，有很多不足，但请相信，它会不停向前 🏃

未来，它一定会成为你离不开的伙伴

尽情发挥你的才华吧！

😘 Enjoy~
